title: Weird Psychiatric Ads Of The Seventies
summary:
Key ideas
- The author shares some of his favorite psychiatric ads from the past century.
- The ads showcase the evolution of how drugs were used in psychiatry over time.
- The author provides commentary and observations about the ads.

Key learnings
- The gray line between ADHD and normal mischievousness has existed for a long time.
- Psychopharmacology used to be viewed as an adjunct for talk therapy.
- Advertisements played a significant role in the success of certain drugs.

Key questions
- To what degree did psychiatrists view drugs as a tool to speed up talk therapy?
- How much of the success of a drug can be attributed to its advertising campaign?
- How have attitudes towards the use of drugs in psychiatry evolved over time?
